titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: d’Alté Aldridge Welch was born in 1907 and attended Johns Hopkins where he received his Masters in 1931 and his Ph.D. in 1937. He was a research fellow in the Department of Mollusks at the Academy of Natural Sciences and was elected a life member in 1928.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence to Welch (1924-1952), almost all from Henry A. Pilsbry. Correspondence is relatively social in nature, arranging dinner plans, for example, with a small amount of discussion of Welch's career, and the work being done at the Academy.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
